citation.article-title: Legionella pneumophila serogroup Lansing 3 isolated from a patient with fatal pneumonia, and descriptions of L. pneumophila subsp. pneumophila subsp. nov., L. pneumophila subsp. fraseri subsp. nov., and L. pneumophila subsp. pascullei subsp. nov.

p.s: Description of Legionella pneumophila subsp. pascullei subsp. nov.

Legionella pneumophila subsp. pascullei (pas cull'e. i; M.L. genitive noun pascullei, in honor of A. William Pasculle for his pioneering studies on media, isolation, and nosocomial spread of L. pneumophila and L. micdadei [23])
Legionella pneumophila subsp. pascullei contains strains of serogroup 5 that hydrolyze hippurate.
The type strain of L. pneumophila subsp. pascullei is U8W (ATCC 33737).
DNAs from all strains of the subspecies are related to U8W at the species level (>95% optimal relatedness, <1% divergence in related sequences, >95% stringent relatedness).
DNA relatedness to other subspecies is below the species level in at least one and usually at least two of the hybridization parameters above.
By enzyme typing, strains within the subspecies are related at a genetic distance of 0.32 and are separated from the other subspecies at a distance of approximately 0.52 (24).
It has been isolated from water in a hospital but not from humans.
The type strain U8W was isolated from water at the Veterans Administration Medical Center, Pittsburgh (12).
It has a G+C of 39 mol% (12).
